lead_paragraph: An inquiry into a fatal airplane crash in California on Wednesday has already yielded findings that raise safety questions about small companies that fly passengers for recreational purposes, a Federal investigator said today. Sixteen people, including the pilot, died when the twin-engine plane, loaded with sky divers, crashed on takeoff from rural Perris Valley Airport, about 60 miles southeast of Los Angeles. The other six people aboard the plane were injured.
